docs.title: Prompt Engineering Playbook for Accountants and Auditors
docs.text: This playbook provides a structured approach to using prompt engineering techniques, tailored to the tasks and activities of accountants and auditors. It focuses on practical examples, strategies, and ethical considerations for interacting with large language models (LLMs).

docs.title: 1. Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Financial Systems as Data Sources: Think of financial records, audit reports, and accounting systems as structured data you interact with.
  • Data Types: Transactions, accounts, compliance records, and performance metrics.
  • Relationships: Financial data often connects, such as payroll linked to tax filings or expenses grouped by department.

  • Unique Identifiers: Use details like transaction IDs or account numbers for specificity.

  • Structured Thinking: Formulate prompts that logically reflect how accountants analyze data—breaking down tasks into clear steps or focused queries.

docs.title: Caveats for Privacy and Sensitive Information
docs.text:
• Confidentiality: Never input sensitive or proprietary financial data, personal information, or client details into an LLM without ensuring the platform adheres to strict privacy and security standards.
  • Data Masking: Replace sensitive information with placeholders or anonymized data.
  • Example: Replace "John Doe" with "Client A" or use sample values instead of real financial figures.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that prompts and outputs comply with laws like GDPR, HIPAA, or financial industry regulations.

docs.title: Ethical Use of LLMs
docs.text:
• Transparency: Inform stakeholders if LLMs are being used to assist with reports or analyses.
  • Validation: Verify all outputs independently to avoid reliance on potentially inaccurate or biased information.
  • Bias Awareness: Recognize that LLMs may inadvertently introduce biases or hallucinations (fabricated information) into outputs.
  • Organizational Restrictions: Respect organizational policies that limit or prohibit the use of generative AI for specific functions, especially in regulated industries.

docs.title: Basic Prompts
docs.text:
• Use direct questions or requests to retrieve insights.
  • Example: "What are the main risks identified in this audit report?"
  • Example: "Summarize the findings related to asset utilization for the last quarter."

docs.title: Detailed Prompts
docs.text:
• Include clear instructions to guide responses.
  • Example: "List all compliance issues identified in audit findings, along with their financial impact and recommended actions."

docs.title: Focused Prompts
docs.text:
• Narrow the scope of your prompt to specific criteria.
  • Example: "Highlight all discrepancies in financial records exceeding $5,000 and suggest possible causes."

docs.title: Structured Prompts
docs.text:
• Organize your prompts to reflect a specific output format.
  • Example: "Provide a summary of this financial report with these headings: Overview, Key Findings, Risks, and Recommendations."

docs.title: Role-based Prompts
docs.text:
• Assign roles to guide how the model responds.
  • Example: "You are a financial auditor preparing a report. Identify the key financial risks observed during your review."

docs.title: Instructional Prompts
docs.text:
• Provide step-by-step instructions.
  • Example: "Explain how to prepare adjusting journal entries to correct discrepancies in a trial balance."

docs.title: Few-shot Prompts
docs.text:
• Include examples to demonstrate the desired output.
  • Example:
    • Input: "Here are examples of audit findings:
    • Duplicate invoices in vendor payments.
    • Non-compliance with financial reporting standards. Based on these examples, generate similar findings for this data."

docs.title: Dynamic Prompts
docs.text:
• Use context-specific or real-time data in your prompts.
  • Example: "Using this data—Revenue: $5,000,000; Expenses: $4,200,000; Taxes Paid: $400,000—generate a summary of financial performance for the quarter."

docs.title: Iterative Refinement
docs.text:
• Start with a broad prompt and refine it for better results.
  • Example:
    • Initial: "Analyze inefficiencies in the payroll system."
    • Refined: "Analyze the payroll system for inefficiencies, such as overpayments, underpayments, or delays, and provide actionable recommendations."

docs.title: Error Analysis
docs.text:
• Identify gaps or errors in responses and adjust prompts to improve clarity.
  • Example:
    • Problem: The output includes irrelevant details.
    • Solution: Specify, "Only include discrepancies above $10,000 and focus on compliance-related issues."

docs.title: Prompt Engineering
docs.text:
• Break down complex tasks into manageable steps.
  • Example: "Create a checklist for evaluating financial and operational controls in an accounting system, focusing on fraud prevention, policy adherence, and efficiency."

docs.title: Financial Summaries
docs.text: • "Summarize the key points of this audit report, focusing on critical financial risks and operational inefficiencies."

docs.title: Compliance and Risk Analysis
docs.text: • "Identify compliance gaps and financial risks from this set of financial statements."

docs.title: Budget Insights
docs.text: • "Compare actual expenses to budgeted costs and highlight any variances, along with possible reasons."

docs.title: Data Verification
docs.text: • "Cross-check payroll records against tax filings to identify mismatches in reported earnings and tax payments."

docs.title: Tax Preparation
docs.text: • "Calculate the taxes owed for a business using the following information: Revenue, deductions, and tax rates."

docs.title: Fraud Detection
docs.text: • "Analyze this set of financial transactions to identify potential indicators of fraud or non-compliance."

docs.title: Audit Reporting
docs.text: • "Prepare a detailed audit report summarizing findings, including inefficiencies in cash flow, compliance issues, and recommended actions."

docs.title: Step 1: Define Your Goal
docs.text:
• Clearly articulate what you need to know or achieve.
  • Example: "I need a summary of discrepancies in financial statements for Q3."

docs.title: Step 2: Identify Key Details
docs.text:
• Provide context and focus areas in your prompt.
  • Example: "Focus on discrepancies above $10,000 and include recommendations."

docs.title: Step 3: Choose a Structure
docs.text:
• Specify how the output should be organized.
  • Example: "Summarize findings using these sections: Overview, Key Issues, and Recommendations."

docs.title: Step 4: Review and Refine
docs.text:
• Analyze the output and tweak the prompt for precision.
  • Example: "Add more detail about the financial impact of these discrepancies."

docs.title: Best Practices for Accountants and Auditors
docs.text:
1. Avoid Sensitive Data: Always use anonymized or sample data in prompts.
  2. Validate Outputs: Double-check generated results for accuracy and reliability.
  3. Stay Compliant: Ensure usage aligns with industry regulations and organizational policies.
  4. Educate Stakeholders: Communicate the role of LLMs in your work and highlight their limitations.
  5. Use Responsibly: Consider ethical implications and transparency when applying AI tools.

This is just a primer to get you started. The key is to start and iterate on the outputs you get.

Happy Prompting!

docs.title: Prompt Engineering Playbook for Budget Analysts
docs.text: This playbook provides a structured approach to using prompt engineering techniques, tailored to the tasks and activities of budget analysts. It focuses on strategies for generating actionable insights, practical examples, and ethical considerations when using large language models (LLMs).

docs.title: 1. Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Budgeting as Structured Analysis: Budget analysis involves understanding financial data relationships and drawing conclusions.
  • Data Types: Budget reports, financial records, expenditure data, and cost-benefit analyses.
  • Key Focus Areas: Trends, variances, compliance, and recommendations.

  • Stakeholder Context: Include input from managers, departmental reports, and regulatory guidelines.

  • Problem-Solving Framework: Use prompts to break down complex financial tasks into manageable insights and recommendations.

docs.title: Caveats for Privacy and Sensitive Information
docs.text:
• Confidentiality: Avoid sharing proprietary budget details, sensitive financial data, or personal information.
  • Data Anonymization: Replace sensitive information with placeholders.
  • Example: Replace "XYZ Department" with "Department A" or use sample numbers instead of actual figures.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure adherence to legal standards, such as GDPR or organizational policies.

docs.title: Ethical Use of LLMs
docs.text:
• Transparency: Communicate clearly when LLMs are used for decision support.
  • Validation: Verify LLM outputs against actual data sources to avoid errors.
  • Bias Mitigation: Acknowledge that LLMs might introduce biases, especially in policy or funding recommendations.
  • Organizational Policies: Ensure compliance with company rules on AI usage.

docs.title: Basic Prompts
docs.text:
• Use direct queries for insights.
  • Example: "Summarize the key trends from last quarter's budget report."
  • Example: "What factors might cause discrepancies in this department's budget?"

docs.title: Detailed Prompts
docs.text:
• Provide context to refine results.
  • Example: "Analyze this financial data to identify cost-saving opportunities across all departments, focusing on recurring expenses."

docs.title: Focused Prompts
docs.text:
• Limit scope for precision.
  • Example: "Highlight budget variances exceeding 5% and suggest possible reasons."

docs.title: Structured Prompts
docs.text:
• Request outputs in specific formats.
  • Example: "Create a budget summary using these headings: Overview, Variances, Trends, and Recommendations."

docs.title: Role-Based Prompts
docs.text:
• Assign roles to guide responses.
  • Example: "You are a budget analyst preparing a report for senior management. Summarize the financial trends and highlight areas of concern."

docs.title: Instructional Prompts
docs.text:
• Provide step-by-step guidance.
  • Example: "Explain how to prepare a departmental budget that aligns with company-wide financial goals."

docs.title: Few-Shot Prompts
docs.text:
• Use examples to illustrate expected output.
  • Example:
    • Input: "Examples of cost-saving measures:
    • Consolidating vendor contracts.
    • Reducing overtime expenses. Generate similar measures for this department's budget."

docs.title: Dynamic Prompts
docs.text:
• Incorporate real-time data.
  • Example: "Based on this data—Revenue: $10M; Expenses: $9.2M; Forecast Growth: 3%—determine if budget adjustments are necessary."

docs.title: Iterative Refinement
docs.text:
• Start with a general prompt and refine for specificity.
  • Example:
    • Initial: "Analyze this department's budget for inefficiencies."
    • Refined: "Identify inefficiencies in travel and training expenses exceeding $5,000 and recommend alternatives."

docs.title: Error Analysis
docs.text:
• Diagnose and address issues in responses.
  • Example:
    • Problem: The model suggests irrelevant recommendations.
    • Solution: Specify, "Focus only on operational inefficiencies impacting the Q2 budget."

docs.title: Prompt Engineering
docs.text:
• Break complex tasks into components.
  • Example: "Analyze financial trends, identify cost overruns, and recommend corrective actions for each department."

docs.title: Budget Summaries
docs.text: • "Summarize this operating budget, highlighting key changes compared to the previous year."

docs.title: Trend Analysis
docs.text: • "Identify trends in departmental spending over the last three years and their potential impact on future budgets."

docs.title: Cost-Benefit Analysis
docs.text: • "Perform a cost-benefit analysis comparing two proposed programs, considering initial costs and long-term savings."

docs.title: Variance Analysis
docs.text: • "Identify budget variances exceeding the allocated amount and suggest corrective measures."

docs.title: Policy Alignment
docs.text: • "Review this budget proposal to ensure alignment with organizational financial policies and goals."

docs.title: Efficiency Improvement
docs.text: • "Suggest three strategies to improve operational efficiency in this program’s budget."

docs.title: Budget Recommendations
docs.text: • "Evaluate this funding request and provide a recommendation for approval or disapproval, including supporting reasons."

docs.title: Step 1: Define Your Goal
docs.text:
• Clearly articulate the outcome you need.
  • Example: "I need to identify overspending trends in this department's budget."

docs.title: Step 2: Provide Context
docs.text:
• Include relevant details to focus the response.
  • Example: "Focus on expenses related to marketing campaigns over the last two years."

docs.title: Step 3: Specify the Output Structure
docs.text:
• Describe the desired format of the response.
  • Example: "Summarize using these sections: Key Findings, Areas for Improvement, and Recommendations."

docs.title: Step 4: Review and Iterate
docs.text:
• Refine prompts based on output quality.
  • Example: "Expand the analysis to include long-term cost projections."

docs.title: Best Practices for Budget Analysts
docs.text:
1. Data Privacy: Always anonymize data before input.
  2. Validation: Cross-check outputs for accuracy and compliance.
  3. Regulatory Awareness: Ensure that prompts align with financial regulations and reporting standards.
  4. Stakeholder Engagement: Clearly communicate how LLMs are integrated into your workflows.
  5. Iterative Refinement: Continuously improve prompts to generate high-quality outputs.

This is just a primer to get you started. The key is to start and iterate on the outputs you get.

Happy Prompting!

docs.title: Prompt Engineering Playbook for Cost Estimators
docs.text: This playbook provides a structured approach to using prompt engineering techniques tailored to the tasks and activities of cost estimators. It focuses on practical examples, strategies, and ethical considerations for interacting with large language models (LLMs).

docs.title: 1. Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Cost Estimation as a Process: Cost estimators analyze data and project requirements to determine time, materials, and expenses. Effective prompts should reflect these structured, detail-oriented processes.
  • Data Types: Blueprints, financial records, historical cost data, material specifications, and labor rates.
  • Relationships: Connect project requirements to cost drivers (e.g., labor, materials, time).

  • Unique Identifiers: Project names, vendor IDs, or bid numbers.

  • Structured Problem Solving: Formulate prompts to break down complex cost estimation tasks into manageable steps or modules.

docs.title: Caveats for Privacy and Sensitive Information
docs.text:
• Confidentiality: Avoid sharing proprietary project plans, financial data, or vendor agreements without ensuring the platform adheres to strict data security standards.
  • Anonymized Data: Replace sensitive details with placeholders or use generalized examples.
  • Example: Replace "ABC Corporation Project" with "Client A Project" or use fictitious values.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure prompts and outputs adhere to industry standards and regulations like construction codes or financial reporting laws.

docs.title: Ethical Use of LLMs
docs.text:
• Transparency: Clearly inform stakeholders when LLMs are used in cost estimation processes.
  • Validation: Double-check outputs for accuracy, as LLMs may produce errors or overgeneralized results.
  • Bias and Fairness: Be aware that outputs might reflect biases in historical data and ensure fair cost estimates for all stakeholders.
  • Organizational Restrictions: Respect internal policies on AI usage, particularly in sensitive or high-stakes projects.

docs.title: Basic Prompts
docs.text:
• Use straightforward prompts to gather general insights.
  • Example: "What are the standard costs for construction materials in urban areas?"
  • Example: "Summarize the main cost drivers for this project based on labor and materials."

docs.title: Detailed Prompts
docs.text:
• Provide clear instructions for more precise responses.
  • Example: "Create a cost breakdown for a residential construction project, including labor, materials, and equipment expenses."

docs.title: Focused Prompts
docs.text:
• Specify criteria to narrow down results.
  • Example: "Identify labor costs for electricians based on this project blueprint, assuming 40 hours of work."

docs.title: Structured Prompts
docs.text:
• Request organized output in a specific format.
  • Example: "Generate a report summarizing material costs under these headings: Material Type, Quantity, Cost per Unit, and Total Cost."

docs.title: Role-based Prompts
docs.text:
• Assign roles to guide responses in a specialized context.
  • Example: "You are a cost estimator preparing a bid for a construction project. Identify potential areas for cost savings."

docs.title: Instructional Prompts
docs.text:
• Provide step-by-step instructions for comprehensive answers.
  • Example: "Analyze this blueprint and estimate material costs based on the following assumptions: Concrete at $120/ton, Steel at $0.50/lb, and labor at $40/hour."

docs.title: Few-shot Prompts
docs.text:
• Include examples to demonstrate desired outcomes.
  • Example:
    • Input: "Here are historical cost data examples:
    • Project A: $500,000 (Labor: $300,000; Materials: $200,000)
    • Project B: $700,000 (Labor: $400,000; Materials: $300,000) Generate a similar breakdown for this project based on a total cost of $600,000."

docs.title: Dynamic Prompts
docs.text:
• Integrate real-time data or changing conditions.
  • Example: "Using the latest market rates for materials and labor, estimate the total cost of building a 10,000-square-foot office space."

docs.title: Iterative Refinement
docs.text:
• Start with general prompts and refine for improved accuracy.
  • Example:
    • Initial: "Estimate the cost of this project."
    • Refined: "Estimate the total cost of this project, focusing on labor costs, material expenses, and transportation fees, assuming a project timeline of 12 weeks."

docs.title: Error Analysis
docs.text:
• Identify errors or gaps in responses and adjust prompts accordingly.
  • Example:
    • Problem: Output omits labor costs.
    • Solution: Add, "Include detailed labor costs based on $50/hour for skilled workers."

docs.title: Prompt Engineering
docs.text:
• Break complex tasks into modular steps.
  • Example: "Step 1: Analyze the blueprint for material requirements. Step 2: Estimate labor costs based on a team of 10 workers. Step 3: Combine material and labor costs for the final estimate."

docs.title: Project Bidding
docs.text: • "Prepare a detailed cost estimate for bidding on this construction project, including labor, materials, and overhead."

docs.title: Vendor Selection
docs.text: • "Evaluate supplier bids based on cost and delivery timelines. Recommend the most cost-effective vendor."

docs.title: Historical Data Analysis
docs.text: • "Analyze these historical cost data to identify trends in material price increases over the last five years."

docs.title: Cost Monitoring
docs.text: • "Track project costs and compare actual expenditures to the initial budget. Highlight any variances exceeding 10%."

docs.title: Negotiation Support
docs.text: • "Generate a summary of cost comparisons for subcontractors, highlighting potential savings areas for negotiation."

docs.title: Risk Assessment
docs.text: • "Identify cost risks associated with this project, such as labor shortages or material price volatility."

docs.title: Efficiency Studies
docs.text: • "Evaluate the cost-effectiveness of in-house production vs. outsourcing for these project components."

docs.title: Step 1: Define Your Goal
docs.text:
• Clearly state the purpose of the prompt.
  • Example: "I need a detailed estimate of material costs for a commercial building project."

docs.title: Step 2: Identify Key Details
docs.text:
• Provide relevant context and specifics.
  • Example: "Focus on concrete and steel materials based on these dimensions: 10,000 square feet, 12-inch walls."

docs.title: Step 3: Choose a Structure
docs.text:
• Specify the desired output format.
  • Example: "Present the cost estimate in a table with these columns: Item, Quantity, Cost per Unit, and Total Cost."

docs.title: Step 4: Review and Refine
docs.text:
• Assess the response and iterate for precision.
  • Example: "Add more details about delivery costs for materials."

docs.title: Best Practices for Cost Estimators
docs.text:
1. Maintain Confidentiality: Use sample or anonymized data whenever possible.
  2. Validate Outputs: Cross-check generated results with independent calculations or expert review.
  3. Comply with Standards: Ensure estimates align with relevant codes, standards, and organizational policies.
  4. Communicate Clearly: Explain the role of LLMs in generating cost estimates to stakeholders.
  5. Use Judiciously: Avoid over-reliance on AI; integrate outputs into broader analytical workflows.

This playbook is a starting point to enhance your cost estimation tasks with prompt engineering techniques. Use it as a guide to improve efficiency and decision-making.

Happy Prompting!
